data.name: pmdorand:wip
data.value: Version[br] Heavily in-development,[br] problems may arise.

data.name: pmdorand:topmenu
data.comment: Label of the randomizer option on the title (top) menu.

data.name: pmdorand:title
data.comment: Title of the Randomizer window when opened.

data.name: pmdorand:top.seeding
data.comment: Label of the seeding menu option, used to control how things randomize.

data.name: pmdorand:top.pokemon
data.comment: Label of the Pokemon menu option, containing stat, ability, and evolution randomization.

data.name: pmdorand:top.items
data.comment: Label of the Items menu option, containing item stat and appearance randomization.

data.name: pmdorand:top.moves
data.comment: Label of the Moves menu options, controlling Power, AoE, and typing.

data.name: pmdorand:top.dungeons
data.comment: Label of the Dungeons menu option, controlling dungeon appearance and traits.

data.name: pmdorand:top.naming
data.comment: Label of the Naming menu option, controlling dungeon, item, and Pokemon names.

data.name: pmdorand:top.statuses
data.comment: Label of the Status Effects menu option.

data.name: pmdorand:top.save
data.comment: Label of the Save menu option.

data.name: pmdorand:top.clear
data.value: This will clear every modified file from the randomizer, returning everything to normal.[br]Your current save will likely not play correctly after this.[pause=0] Continue?

data.name: pmdorand:pkmn.typing.rand.description
data.value: Toggles randomization for Pokemon types.[br]Disable to keep Pokemon types as they should be.

data.name: pmdorand:pkmn.typing.duplicates.description
data.value: Allows a Pokemon's first and second type to be identical.

data.name: pmdorand:pkmn.typing.retainDual.description
data.value: Makes Pokemon keep the same amount of types that they originally had.

data.name: pmdorand:pkmn.typing.retainment.description
data.value: Controls whether a Pokemon's first or second type should be kept during randomization.

data.name: pmdorand:pkmn.moves.rand.description
data.value: Randomizes the moves that a Pokemon can learn and obtain.

data.name: pmdorand:pkmn.moves.initialMoves.description
data.value: The amount of moves that every Pokemon is guaranteed to have at Level 1.

data.name: pmdorand:pkmn.moves.initialAttacks.description
data.value: The amount of starting moves that have to be physical or special attacks.

data.name: mentoolkit:description/randomize/itemeffects.description
data.value: Allows item effects to be changed!

data.name: mentoolkit:description/randomize/itemeffect.description
data.value: Allows the effect to appear on or modify items.

data.name: mentoolkit:description/itemeffect/appearance.description
data.value: Submenu for settings that control how often and on what items an effect can appear on.

data.name: mentoolkit:description/itemeffect/modify.description
data.value: Controls the rate that this effect can change items that it might already appear on.

data.name: mentoolkit:description/itemeffect/disappear.description
data.value: Determines how often an effect can disappear from items that it might normally be on.

data.name: pmdorand:effect/item/HealthRestoration.description
data.value: Add health recovery to random items, change it on others... or take it away.

data.name: pmdorand:effect/item/PerishSong.description
data.value: Be wary! Some items might have a run-ending effect if used too often...

data.name: pmdorand:effect/item/HeartAttackMachine.description
data.value: A single use of this item will mean the end of your life...

data.name: pmdorand:config/effect/item/HealthRestoration/flatDifference.description
data.value: When enabled, Max Difference becomes a flat number.[br][br](+- 20% becomes +- 0.2)

data.name: pmdorand:config/effect/item/HealthRestoration/maxDifference.description
data.value: How much positive or negative deviation healing effects are given.[br](20% means 80% - 120%)

data.name: pmdorand:config/effect/item/HealthRestoration/appearanceSettings.description
data.value: Options specific to when the effect appears on a new item.

data.name: PMDOR_CHANGELOG_2025-03-23
data.value:
Project code is now available on GitHub!
Type randomization for Pokemon has been updated to work with blacklist as well as retaining secondary type and avoiding duplicates. Wahoo! Some type randomization options are also available in the in-game menu.
